greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Total number of prime factors of 3-smooth numbers.
link: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: smoothNumbers[p_, max_] := Module[{a, aa, k, pp, iter}, k = PrimePi[p]; aa = Array[a, k]; pp = Prime[Range[k]]; iter = Table[{a[j], 0, PowerExpand @ Log[pp[[j]], max/Times @@ (Take[pp, j-1]^Take[aa, j-1])]}, {j, 1, k}]; Table[Times @@ (pp^aa), Sequence @@ iter // Evaluate] // Flatten // Sort]; PrimeOmega /@ smoothNumbers[3, 10^5] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 11 2016 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 18 2002
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 27 2008 at the suggestion of _R. J. Mathar_.
